moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nd4 4. Nxd4 e: Up to now, this is the Main Line of Bird's Defense. All these moves are book.
moves.10. Bf1: Threatening to take over the center [10... PxP 11 NPxP, followed by 12 P-Q4.]
moves.10... d3: If White tries 11 R-K3 trapping the QP, Black plays 11... P-KN4! 12 RxP P-N5 with strong pressure.
moves.11. f4 Qb6+: Taking immediate advantage of the newly open diagonal.
moves.12... h5 13. fxe5 Bg4: This Bishop is taboo [14 PxB??? PxP mate.]
moves.14. Qb3 Qf2 15. Qxb7: There is no better option [15 R-Q1 is answered by either 15... B-Q7 or 15... BxR].
moves.16... Bxd1 17. Qxc6+: Now Black can't interpose the B.
moves.17... Ke7 18. Qc7+ Rd7 19. exd6+ Kf6: The Rook cannot be taken [20 QxR QxB ch 21 K-R2 Q-B5 ch 22 K-N1 BxP! 23 Q-B5 ch QxQ 24 PxQ B-N6!!! and White has no defense against 25... R-K1 and 26... R-K8 mate.]
moves.23. c4 Qf4+ 24. Kh1 Kf6: White resigns, as he must now lose either the Queen or the King.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
